thread.title: New Market Research Report Tissue and Hygiene in the Czech Republic
thread.title_full: New Market Research Report Tissue and Hygiene in the Czech Republic | MENAFN.COM

author: Press
title: New Market Research Report Tissue and Hygiene in the Czech Republic
text:
(MENAFN Press) As the economic situation started to improve and the unemployment rate started to decline in 2014 the mood of Czech consumers and their willingness to spend money improved. As a result demand for tissue and hygiene increased in 2014 compared to that of 2013 and nearly all product categories registered better development in both volume and current value terms in 2014. Nevertheless nappies/diapers/pants was an exception as this category was influenced by a legislative change which increased...
Euromonitor International's Tissue and Hygiene in Czech Republic report offers a comprehensive guide to the size and shape of the market at a national level. It provides the latest retail sales data 2010-2014 allowing you to identify the sectors driving growth. It identifies the leading companies the leading brands and offers strategic analysis of key factors influencing the market - be they new product developments distribution or pricing issues. Forecasts to 2019 illustrate how the market is set to change.
Full Report Details at
 - 
Product coverage: Away-From-Home Tissue and Hygiene Retail Tissue and Hygiene Total Tissue and Hygiene.
Data coverage: market sizes (historic and forecasts) company shares brand shares and distribution data.
Reasons to Get this Report
 * Get a detailed picture of the Tissue and Hygiene market;
 * Pinpoint growth sectors and identify factors driving change;
 * Understand the competitive environment the market's major players and leading brands;
 * Use five-year forecasts to assess how the market is predicted to develop.
Euromonitor International has over 40 years' experience of publishing market research reports business reference books and online information systems. With offices in London Chicago Singapore Shanghai Vilnius Dubai Cape Town Santiago Sydney Tokyo and Bangalore and a network of over 800 analysts worldwide Euromonitor International has a unique capability to develop reliable information resources to help drive informed strategic planning.
